intro: Muraltia decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive muraltia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces pods that contain edible seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Its name "deceptive" may refer to its ability to mimic other plants or its misleading appearance.
